alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Newton; Rankin; Scott; Smith (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 2:59PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Jasper, southeastern Rankin, southwestern Newton, northern Smith and southern Scott Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 259 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Johns, or 11 miles southwest of Morton, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Pulaski around 310 PM CDT. Homewood around 320 PM CDT. Lawrence and Roberts around 340 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Polkville and Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
